definition: Zhu Yuanzhang, personal name of first Ming dynasty emperor Hongwu 洪武[Hong2 wu3]
surname Zhu
vermilion
cinnabar/see 硃砂|朱砂[zhu1 sha1]
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
ancient stone ornament

sentences.english: Zhu Yuanzhang is a responsible and ambitious emperor.
sentences.chinese: 朱元璋是一位有抱负的明君。

sentences.english: The Ming dynasty, the Spring Festival couplets real popularization began with zhu yuanzhang's advocate relevant.
sentences.chinese: 春联真正普及始于明代，与朱元璋的提倡有关。

sentences.english: The second interpretation ascribes the practice to Zhu Yuanzhang, the founding emperor of the Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 第二种解释跟明朝开祖皇帝朱元璋有关。

sentences.english: In 1368, Chu Yuanzhang established Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 公元1368年，朱元璋建立明朝，建元洪武。

sentences.english: So, this is what Zhu really looked like.
sentences.chinese: 啊，原来朱元璋就是这个样子。

sentences.english: It was erected by Zhu's son.
What was the content of the ban promulgated by Zhu Yuanzhang?
sentences.chinese: 朱元璋颁布的这项政策内容是什么？

sentences.english: It is the eight things, help zhu yuanzhang relieved hunger.
sentences.chinese: 正是这八样东西，帮助朱元璋解除了饥饿。

sentences.english: Zhu Yuanzhang, founder of Ming Dynasty, granted it the High Mountain Lu.
sentences.chinese: 明太祖朱元璋还曾封庐山为“庐岳”。

sentences.english: A legend in his family says one ancestor used to be a monk and beggar, which is very similar to the deeds of Zhu Yuanzhang, the first emperor of Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 这个传说与明太祖朱元璋极其相似。

sentences.english: The reign of Zhu Yuanzhang lasted about 31 years.
sentences.chinese: 朱元璋统治了大约三十一年。

definition: Zhu Di, personal name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]

reign name of second Ming emperor, reigned 1398-1402, deposed in 1402

tomorrow morning/the following morning
Emperor Taizu of Song, posthumous title of the founding Song emperor Zhao Kuangyin 趙匡胤|赵匡胤 (927-976), reigned from 960
Chongzhen, reign name of last Ming emperor (1628-1644)
Li Zicheng (1605-1645), leader of peasant rebellion at the end of the Ming Dynasty
Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
emperor/CL:個|个[ge4]

war of 1402 between successors of the first Ming Emperor
